us.phonetic: /n., adj., and usually for v. 8 kɑntrækt; otherwise v. kənˈtrækt/, (n., adj., and usually for v. 16–18, 22, 23 kon′trakt; otherwise v. kən trakt′)

example.eg: The company has a contract with the supplier.  The football player signed a contract.
example.egtrans: 公司与供应商订有合同。

example.eg: He contracted with the company to provide services.
example.egtrans: 他与这家公司签订了服务提供合同。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 缩小, 缩短, 收缩

us.phonetic: /n., adj., and usually for v. 8 kɑntrækt; otherwise v. kənˈtrækt/, (n., adj., and usually for v. 16–18, 22, 23 kon′trakt; otherwise v. kən trakt′)

example.eg: The contract worker will find another job.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 签订了合同的, 受合同制约的

example.eg: Her muscles contracted as she lifted the box.
Contract the muscles in your leg when you do this stretch.

us.phonetic: /n., adj., and usually for v. 8 kɑntrækt; otherwise v. kənˈtrækt/, (n., adj., and usually for v. 16–18, 22, 23 kon′trakt; otherwise v. kən trakt′)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 外包, 将...包出去, 承包给某人
将某事外包给某人, 让某人承包某事

us.phonetic: /n., adj., and usually for v. 8 kɑntrækt; otherwise v. kənˈtrækt/, (n., adj., and usually for v. 16–18, 22, 23 kon′trakt; otherwise v. kən trakt′)

example.eg: According to the contract you may take three days of bereavement leave for your uncle's funeral, but only one for your nephew's.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 根据合同, 根据合同条款

example.eg: If there's a breach of contract by your employer, you may be entitled to monetary compensation.
example.egtrans: 如果你的雇主违约，你可能有权获得经济补偿。

example.eg: The company awarded a call-off contract to the supplier.
Contract bridge is even more complicated than regular bridge.
The teachers are hoping to negotiate a more equitable labor contract this year.
The two companies signed a legal contract to regulate their partnership.
He insisted his future wife sign a marriage contract to protect his family's wealth.
